The introduction is great. Leading up to entering the mech I thought I was in for something special. As soon as the gameplay started I regretted my purchase. Being inside the mech feels terrible. It seems taller from the outside. The weapons sound and feel ineffectual. The punching mechanic is even worse. The way the sheilds work (short timer, small coverage) isn't fun. Don't use the free version with PvP only, don't buy it to go into PvP. The reason is discussed many times on other comments. BUT if you want a short but nice single player campaign, with a suprisingly good story and even better story telling, an intuitiv to use combat system and a main character that is simply human and thus easy to understand, then this is the game for you. I had a blast with the campaign and even played it twice (still only one day but it was a fun day). Sadly the multiplayer is realy as empty as described and in my opinion worse then the campaign. So don't buy it if this is a no go.

Great game. I felt like I was taking part in a movie. I was very engaged throughout. Remember to listen to all the dialogue inside cockpit after completing a chapter. Usually you get a few dialogue per person till their name is washed out. You can skip dialogue, but then you won't get the story build up.

Is really an on-rails shooter but a good one.  Has decent feel of being inside a mech, good enemy variation in the first half of the game.  Voice acting and story are reasonable and carry it through the 3-4 hour single player campaign.

game is well made, but the pvp sucks  there is no one on, and you will be endlessly stuck in search   there is no interaction with others to find players currently I see them as not existing.  would be much better if you can play single player vs bots to at least practice

Absolutely like it!

Slight nuances i feel could be better:
Missed some fusion trails in squad veichles and also wish to have some barely recognizable sound to mech movements. When he walks, moves arms in different directions.

Figuring out what to say for this review was difficult due to the disgustingly small charcter max for reviews. The game itself is an on rails shooter that only really LOOKS like it's more. This of course works because of the amount of focus there is on combat. I'll summarize everything like this.

How did the game feel?
The game felt great, but not sitting down in a chair to play felt awful as I would sway and feel like I would lose my balance with the constant mech movement which is entirely out of your control. Gunplay was standard, and the game's mechanics were challenging enough that learning them was a fun experience that wasn't necessarily a hassle. Difficulty with the exception of a few sections scaled nicely and wasn't obscenely high for no apparent reason.

How did the game look?
The game looked pretty standard. The mechs were extremely detailed and I enjoyed looking over every last bit I could.

How did the game peform?
Sub-par. While I at no time during my 5 hour play experience lag, stuttering, or loss of tracking, I did experience bugs which actually made my experience quite frustrating at times. The worst part is that these bugs are often GAME BREAKING and will require you to restart the game to fix. These include:
-Respawning causing you to be unable to damage or receieve damage. This carries over if you head to the main menu
-Rockets fired at you will be untargetable and will always hit you regardless if you shoot them or even use a shield (which can block a single one)
-Options menu doesn't close if you resume play. You have to MANUALLY close the menu.
-Incorrect gendered voicelines were played as the female protagonist.
-The game will refuse to allow the firing of any rockets. This will persist for up to 30 seconds at a time.
-Enemies will occasionally not despawn and shoot at you from behind with the enemy indicator persisting until level completion.

Final Note. Difficulty spikes through unfair game mechanics aren't HARD, they're annoying.
It's dead. IDK if it's just NA servers, but the highest I've seen is 12 players. At one point I was the only player in the game. You all need to get your game out there, it's truly amazing.

Love the Game etc... wow!!!!  Sad Part it Keeps crashing out sometimes or dont load up... Only Happens when I get to the good part where lots of actions etc.. is at...  Other than that I love this game

Short written review is as follows: 

Cartoons like Gundam, Voltron, and Evangelion were some of my favorites growing up, so suffice it to say I was really excited about the launch of Hawken, which was a mech game that was supposed to offer VR support. Working in the industry, I got to try it briefly at a preview event running on the Oculus Rift DK2 many years back. While I enjoyed what little I played of the mech shooter, Hawken was ultimately shut down and VR support was never officially implemented. This was really disappointing to hear, but I thought we'd probably get a bunch of other mech games by now considering VR is such a great fit for the genre. ...unfortunately, it's been pretty quiet on that front, until now. Archangel Hellfire is out, and it may be the best mech game ever made.

Like all great competitive games Archangel Hellfire is easy to get into, hard to master. The base PVP multiplayer is also completely free! So there's no reason you shouldn't be playing it! The paid version unlocks co-op gameplay and more mech skins plus the single player Archangel campaign. Considering Hellfire is just so much fun though, it's a game well worth supporting.
review_feedback: Thanks so much for the support! See you on the battlefield, Pilot!

I picked this up during the Summer Sale because they added, free-roaming, multi-player. I had been aware of ARCHANGEL since it was released, but wouldn't buy it due to being an "on rail" shooter. Well, I was wrong with my opinion. The single-player game looks great and the little bit of story that I've experienced has also been great. The "on rail" , isn't an issue. I was too busy paying attention to the story and playing, that I never thought about it. So, the single-player part of ARCHANGEL HELLFIRE is worth the $18 price tag. I'll be able to spend more time with the game tomorrow and maybe even get a chance to play some PVP. I am liking what I've seen so far. Just the single-player is worth the 4 stars. If multi-player is as fun, then I'll raise my review to 5 stars. Thanks for adding multi-player. It grabbed my attention and made me look into this game further. With enough people buying this game through the Summer Sale, there should be enough players to get the ball rolling on PVP.///UPDATE/// Plays just fine on an i5 4690-16GB RAM-GTX1070.

I mainly bought this for the campaign and because i always wondered what it'd feel being inside a Goldorak or any Mech like Pacific Rim... Sad it'S a rail game, but that's ok, i love all different types of games. My only major deception even thugh as stupid it might sound is, i'm having the feeling we are in a floating head moving around, as i feel like we are way too close to the ground as if there was no body or legs attached, hard to explain.. but as the hands seems to be so close to the ground, it's maybe just a matter of perspective, but besides this, i like it, i do a mission once in a while not to finish the game too fast. Only other issue i jsut find is, the shield, seems hard, when altening between left and right shield, to acutualy be able to bring for exemple, my left arm more to cover up to my right side, as you would hold a shield, you would be able to cover at least up to your left shoulder, but we seem to leave a blind spot when one of the two shield are recharging. But in no way so far i regret my purchased. Just hope you guys will evnetualy come up with DLC so all the effort put in the game doesn't go for nothing. :) Always sad when you finish a game you like for the campaign and no DLC ever see the day.

Wanna feel like you are in a giant mech? Want to mow down tanks and enemies with a giant arm cannon? Seriously though, this game is a really cool experience. I would try out the pvp mode if you get the game, it is well worth it.

one_reviews_text:
I enjoy this game a lot.  For any Battletech fans, this is the closest we have to being able to be an actual mech pilot!  Lots of fun, and good system that eases you into the gameplay.  

Thank you much for creating this game, and the price point on it makes it a no-brainer.  If anyone is having doubts about purchasing it, I would urge you to swallow those doubts and start the download now.  There's no way you won't get your money's worth in the first two hours!  

I did want to mention a couple things that I would like to see if they could be addressed.  I'm taking the time to write this review specifically because I noticed that this company seems to read and respond to reviews that are posted, and I think that warrants me taking some time to write a review.

For the solo play game.  I read an online review that talked about NewGame+, it was an option after completing the game to start a new game keeping all of the upgrades you unlocked to that point.  Since you aren't able to even come close to upgrading everyhing in a single run-through, this would be a great option.  At first I thought maybe they didn't make that option available because I played it on easy, so I beat it again on Normal, but that didn't seem to matter.  It was a little disheatening.  

The second is the ability to skip the intro scene if you've already watched it once.  You guys did an amazing job on it, but after beating the game multiple times, it would be nice to have the option to not have to watch it again if I didn't want to just because of its length. 

The last thing is my in-game height.  The ground appears closer to me than I think it should be given the height of the mech.  I think I should be higher off the ground since I'm sitting in the cockpit of the mech and not it's chest or stomach.  

Those issues being said, I still tip my hat to you on creating a wonderful game!
review_feedback: Thanks so much for the thoughtful and passionate review. Players like you make the blood, sweat and tears that is game development all worth it. Will look into your requests, Hope to see you on the battlefield.

one_reviews_text:
(Updated Review, please see below) I love the idea of the game itself, being in the cockpit of a massive mech and having dual targetting systems is ALOT of fun.  While the single player campaign is incredibly fun I have yet to dive into the multiplayer much yet as my first attempt was met with a very minimal lobby of players.  The game is challenging while at the same time rewarding your growing skill as a pilot.  Its goal was clearly to give you the feeling of being a pilot in a massive mech, and it does this well.

What I've played? Roughly 2 hours of single player campaign.  I have not tried the Archangel: Hellfire multiplayer as of this review.

(Update: My initial review was critical of two issues; the main screen to switch between Archangel, and Hellfire as well as an issue I encountered in the 2nd level having difficulty breaking a bridge.  I am happy to report both issues have been resolved, Skydance fixed the menu issue and today I was able to move past the bridge issue as I found you indeed had to punch while holding down the trigger buttons to ball your fists.  I had been too busy focusing on defense to realize this had been my mistake until my 5th attempt.  I have updated my review to reflect this and heavily recommend this game for anyone that enjoys Pacific Rim and single player campaigns.)
review_feedback: Great review man and thanks for the update. We are planning a free PVP period at launch, which should fix a lot of the queue issues. We have many more activities happening after e3! Stay tuned :)

one_reviews_text:
I purchased Archangel months ago. Didn't notice it was win 10 only until it was too late. Why in God's name would you make the Rift version Win10 only, but the Steam version plays fine in Win7? You guys cut yourselves off from alot revenue.
 Downloaded the Hellfire update and it worked with Win 7. Selected ArchAngel at the start screen and it ALSO worked with Win7. Had a match with 1 other player so far. reminded me of a proper VR version of Hawken, but with NO VR sickness! Bravo Devs! You cracked it! 
It just takes 30 seconds or so to load the main menu, so don't think it crashed. Just wait and viola. If the game is crashing on you, repair your oculus install. I'm running Win 7 and GTX 1080 and repaired my install last week and it plays like butter.

one_reviews_text:
A so-so game. It is an on rail experience, so if you are looking for free movement this is not the game for you.

On the plus side, the game is very polished (not the visials on buildings), and combat works nice and flewently.

Game is somewhat short and the replay factor is not great.

Good starting title, and will be interested in the next game they come up with that is not on rails.
review_feedback: We heard you and all those that asked for this and that is why we updated the game with Hellfire, our PVP off rais Team Deathmatch mode. Come try it out :)

one_reviews_text: First, the story is: "insert any excuse for revenge here" - It's simplistic. ... Graphics are very nice. The intro is longer then the tutorial but this because your weapon and shield options are so simplistic! The game play sums up into you standing in one spot while they throw things at you. Yes they modeled movement but you don't control any of that movement. They do ALL of the driving. You really have no strategic input at all. So in the final analysis, you stand there and shoot. That’s the whole game. No one shoots from the rear further emphasizing the simplistic/arcade nature of this (ahum) game..... HUD implementation is simply stupid! Hull, shield and weapon meters are in the periphery of your view but they also modeled HEAD MOVEMENT into the mech cockpit so when you turn your head to look at your meters, the meters move too! You have a punch ability that is really dumb because even though it looks really cool, they control all movement so you can only punch something when they intentionally set up a scenario for you to punch, it’s not a strategic weapon choice or option! The weapon and shield combinations are no less simplistic and infantile…. This game would be absolutely no different if they just held you in one place while they threw wave after wave of enemy at you. They drag you through some scenery instead before forcing you to stand in one place, that’s all. 0 Strategy, 0 experience, 0 story, 0 intelligence in the design, decent graphics, decent high level concept they just need a game developer to fill it out. That makes sense though because if you go to their site and check their careers, all they're hiring is INTERNS!

review_title: So good you made me buy it.
one_reviews_text:
Played through the whole game on the free weekend. Couldn't stop thinking about it and had to buy to replay it.

Pros
-Mech is super polished. Well articulated and realistic. Whenever a mission starts I do a little flex and crack the knuckles like pacific rim.
-Last mission is really awe inspiring. Don't wanna spoil but I really wish the whole game was constructed like that. Tension, drama, puzzle, reflex, banter.

Cons
-Environments are rather....fluctuating in quality. Some areas are wide cool expanses, and some are boxy PS2 era cardboard areas.
-Enemies are pretty static...they just kinda, show up left and right of you, in a pre defined making it feel like a shooting gallery rather than a combat scenario. The hound enemies moved and weaved making them feel more like an enemy.
-Largely pointless male and female choice system. It feels like that budget could have gone to better use. hiring a second voice actor to rerecord and reanimate the backstory. Male protagonist, female protagonist, I don't really care which way. Its not like its a dragon age style RPG.


I am looking forward to any future projects you have. Archangels? Archangel 2? The finale seemed ripe for a tease...like 5 years later and an army of archangels at the ready against Humanx. 

Some suggestions for the next one would be decide what you wanna be.  Do you want to create a "play your own way" RPG mech? then you need more customisation, mech design, a way to specialise your mech. 

Or a call of duty, time crisis style cinematic action setpiece. Then you need more focused script and intruige in plot more varied gameplay that goes beyond a shooting gallery. see titanfall for a good example of this it has time travel, chase sequence on top of a convoy, ticking time bomb, all out war to name a few scenarios.


Sequel Wishlist
- Mech on Mech battle
- A tighter focused script
- replayability
-moar motion controls

Also I really didn't mind the lack of free locomotion. Just own it and play with it
review_feedback: Thank you so much for the thoughtful review and so glad you liked it and decided to support us with a purchase. We have more plans in store for Archangel, so check in from time to time and hopefully we won't disappoint!

one_reviews_text: This is a great one for sitting in a chair and blasting the crap out of things.  Get it on sale, because it's short.  There are some great moments, and they managed to add some story and drama to what could have been a mindless rail shooter.  Chapters can be replayed, but points for upgrades (on replays) are only awarded for improving on your previous performance.  Lots of potential for sequels or expanding on what's here.
review_feedback: Really loved hearing about your experience! Stay tuned for future updates.

one_reviews_text: Graphics are very good but immersion is not here...instead of being in a walking robot, we feel like being in a silent, flying robot ! the sounds are missing ! too bad because it could have been a great VR hit ! Please developers, improve this in the sequel ! ;) (or patch) . The others spaceships around are not well integrated with the environnement too, animations are not realistic

The storyline - while cliche - is still actually pretty enjoyable. And yes, while the game is on rails, they still got the feeling of being in a giant robot (especially the arm interactions) down extremely well. It's a fun and satisfying game to play, that is over all too quickly.

review_title: Great game - would like it to continue!
one_reviews_text: Awesome game, the story is told well, the voice acting is good, visually very impressive.      Some reviews seem too harsh to me, this is an incredible arcade like experience.  Good job devs and please make a sequal!
I only played 5 min and I needed to Quit. You are not moving very fast. But it still got me insane motion sickness. So if you cant handle motions in VR games like me. Do not buy it.
review_feedback: So sorry to hear this! We build our games to provide the most comfortable experience possible. Did you check your frame rate? DM us on Facebook if you want to have a dialogue about this!

one_reviews_text: Great move devs; the free weekend introduced me to your world and got me hooked; I had to buy it as soon as it was back on sale.  I really didn't expect much and was sure I would not like the onrails nature of the locomotion, but it took one aspect away from me so I could concentrate on the shooting.  I was really surprised and must say  that despite my preconceptions you've done a great job!  A simple shooter but enjoyable all the same...
review_feedback: Thanks so much! Really appreciate the kind words

one_reviews_text: It would be nice to know what the power cells look like when M1 says to concentrate on them. And, it would be nice to have check points after LOTS of dialog so we don't have to sit through it over and over when we are stuck. Makes getting stuck even worse having to hear dialogue scenes repeatedly.
At the end of wolfenburg base, after you die once. Your ammunition no longer has any effect on the enemies. Please have this checked,repeating the one area over and over is not fun. Thank you

A great, polished game - a very enjoyable "must have" title. 

Slight negatives (for me anyway)...
If there are any negatives I would say that that the character choices are limited and didn't really gel with me personally. 
Also, the cut scenes start to get a little repetitive - it would be great to be able to choose to skip these once you've viewed them a few times - then you can just get back in the game instead of being forced to watch them over and over.

That said, it's an excellent game...
review_feedback: Glad you loved it!

one_reviews_text: I had great fun with this game and like similar arcade machine games, or like space pirate trainer, you can reply it just for fun and entertainment again or whenever you want a little mech action - so I think it has some replayability value that other and even similar games do not have. It is very well made.
review_feedback: Thanks so much. We love hearing that you had a good time with the game!

one_reviews_text:
Being the first on the mech genre; I was curious to see what could achieve. So far the game is enjoyable, although it is also suffering from design decisions that could be better.

You start the story as the test pilot of this huge war machine; then onward, it is a shooter on rail, kinda like these games you would find in arcade, where you use your gun to shoot at what the game throw at you.

The issue here is that the game break that feeling of being in a mech; allowing you to use your hands to actually aim. You may find it great (and the feeling of moving gigantic arms with guns is indeed great), but from a gaming perspective, that is the flaw of the game in my opinion.

A better experience would be more cockpit-oriented; there is a fun demo game on Steam where you drive a mech in a single mission, and that game is not on rail, so you use the controls to move, turn AND shoot. The whole thing feels more natural; instead of this game where you feel like driving a mix between a mech and your own body. Either go fully in one way or the other for the next product.

Gameplay is OK; acting and audio are sufficient and in general, the game is fun to play. Get it on sale and it is worth the money in my opinion.

Good game overall.  It's basically a shooting gallery on rails.  That means you do not control your own movement and are largely just responsible for shooting things.  Be aware of this before you buy as there are obviously some reviewers who cannot read.

Regardless I found it to be a unique and fun experience.  I did begin to feel like I was piloting a mech out of pacific rim or something.  Quite enjoyed that.  I liked the characters and the story and found myself getting engaged in their struggle.

Unfortunately it is kind of short.  There are eight chapters.  One mostly establishes the plot and gives a short tutorial and another is purely story leaving you with essentially six levels.  It could really use an endless enemy mode of some kind.

Still, I'd recommend it.  It's worth a play.
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback. Glad you enjoyed it. The team worked really hard at packing as much content as we could into the title. Keep an eye our for our future announcements!

one_reviews_text: Visuals are great. But soundfx was terrible especially the weapons - a waste!
review_feedback: We updated SFX for Hellfire! come check it out

one_reviews_text: Well as a orginal Mech Warroir gamer, (yes been playing that long lol) i have to say it was close but i would have really liked to walk myself around a and shoot behind me. but overall i enjoyed this game, was a lot of fun. looking forward to a new map pack maybe ??
review_feedback: You never know what the future may hold ;)

one_reviews_text:
The game was brilliant and hopefully they add in multiplayer or (like with transformers WFC. Hopefully there will be a VR game for it) escalation.
Also, Bulldog's dialogue was funny throughout the game. ("Anybody got more gum?")

Nothing like being a giant Mech!

Loved the playstyle, just a warning feel free to upgrade everything don't bother to wait as the games too short to not make use of it

The game ran great even though the only minimum req that i didnt have was i had a lower end vid card (GTX 780). I wish to be able to adjust graphics manually instead the game auto adjust. 
Please make a Part 2 game like this!
To short, the game is not up to the standard of what game should be made in 2017.

review_title: Don't bother with the final mission
one_reviews_text:
First off: I had fun. The gameplay is pretty good, it looks nice, and it really gives a good sense of scale to fighting in a 70 ton warmachine.

The plot, however, is mostly mediocre and disolves into nauseating tripe during the final mission. They really needed a decent writer.

The game has a bit of a learning curve. Using the shields effectively is a bit challenging and switching weapons while in combat is a must. The graphics are great and the voice acting is pretty darn good. My only complaints are that there is no way to save mid mission, so if you have to quit you must start from the very beginning, and the waypoints can be a bit too far apart. If you die, sometimes you have to play for a while before you get back to the point where you died. Overall though, I find this game entertaining and would recommend it to anyone looking for a challenge.

review_title: Good game, shame about the bugs
one_reviews_text:
As others have said, there is a bug that randomly removes all collision detection from the game when you restart a checkpoint.

The only way to resolve is to quit and restart the game.

review_title: One of the must haves for VR
one_reviews_text: Best Mech game I've played in VR so far. Very challenging specially in the higher difficulty levels. More games like this plz!

review_title: AAA polished shooter, real short though
one_reviews_text:
Game is really looking nice. The story also is likeable. And dispite the fact you are only controlling shields and weapons, not the mech movement, you still have your hands full. Playing on normal I got wrecked a couple of times. Using the oculus touch controllers I got no technical issues whatsoever. So that's a good thing, but to be expected paying 30 bucks for a game. Overall I enjoyed it pretty much. But right at the moment I was really getting into it, about 5 hours in, the game is over ... What is it with the length of VR games in general? Is it so hard to program the VR environment, that there is no room for a decent amount of 15 hour gameplay? I am not expecting the size of Skyrim or Mass effect 2 here. But for this money it should at least be twice as long. Oh well, at least I still got to play on hard and permadeath modes, so I'm willing to give 4 stars. Could have been 5 with more content...             
UPDATE: Since it only took me 2 hours to finish the game in hard mode, and I am starting to notice things like there not being any lip syncing in the transmissions, i correct my vote from 4 to 3 stars. Game is definitely way to short. 9 missions of about 12 minutes each isn't worth 30€.
If you want a decent shooter you can play sitting down, pick it up on sale. Or wait until there is a free to play weekend and you can play it through completely without paying anything.

The story is too long and can't pass . I was quit  in the practice aim the object . The aim option is't work with touch controls. I can't switch weapon with my touch controls. Finally , I quit the game !

From the first moment I bought the rift I  envisioned a Mazinger based VR game, so grabbed this Mech themed game when it came out, its basically a shooting gallery in which you only control your arms. I hate to give a lower rating, the graphics are good but the gameplay is just meh. I can only play it for a short time before getting bored and switching to something else. Good start though, the experience is worth the price but isn't in my top ten list.

manic annoying game, that takes way too long to get started. Dissapoints you from being able to do what you want constantly. Then random bugs where controls stop working, having to start missions over, reset game. massive chore

This is a great game. I wish you had free movement, but the on-rails did not bother me much in this game. The voice acting is on point for all the character (especially your character and M1). The highlight is definitely the AI M1KL character, and the ending of this game got me tearing up a little. All in all a great start for Mech games for the Touch.

easily 5 stars...until it crashes.  I just can't make it past the post bridge explosion scene.  Sometimes I can't press continue after dying.  Sometimes after continuing I can't shoot enemies anymore.  Sometimes it just crashes with a fatal error when dying.  After that spot i had no problems...so you may be ok.  Its cool....but you may want to hold off until the version is beyond "submission candidate 2".

I watched several videos before buying this and all I can say is that they do not do the game any justice at all. Until you are inside VR and playing this game you have no idea how awesome it is. This game is on rails, BUT... so are some of the best arcade shooters in history. Controlling the mechs arms and weaponry is where the game shines. Switching between various weapons on each arm with ease actually feels like you are piloting the 6 story machine. Story seema to be very well written so far, AAA title for VR. If you're looking for a new shooter that you can sit down and play then this is it. I give it 9/10.

Already been said here that this game is really well acted, has great visual effects and the immersion and experience of being in a giant mech, glorious. Love the RobotJox/Pacific Rim feel to mech control... this gang should pursue the license for the latter to give us an awesome Jaeger game. While on rails, given the chaos that is thrown at you, you won't even notice. Permadeath mode is highly recommended for a real thrill. That rant aside, just wanted to say thanks to the devs for having a person as color as the protagonist that isn't a sambo stereotypical caricature. Truly is appreciated.

Obviously, a lot of money went into developing this game. The opening animation sequence was very good, (presumably created using Microsoft holograpic capture). But I didn't like the character choices, which were apparently selected to please some social justice warriors' fantastical idea of "diversity." One of the two character choices was a woman, despite survey after survey showing the vast majority of action/adventure shoot-em-up gamers are male. As a result, I just couldn't get into the story line of the female character I happened to choose. But the fact is, I really didn't like either of the character choices, which I didn't feel reflected me as a person, but rather, some SJW's idea of what needed to be included foer political correctness purposes. As a unique individual who also reflects the majority of gamers, I didn't feel that my interests or identity were represented, but rather the need to fulfill some political correctness requirement. Such a shame that every industry must be ruined by political correctness, including gaming.

I went in expecting to be bored and it sucking but I was very entertained. Being a fan of Mechs and having played Mech games since the early 90's and online with multplayer battletech,3025,mw4, mwo... this game checked almost all the boxes for me. I was really geeking out when I first got into the cockpit. I'd say it's like an interactive universal studios ride or something and I got my money's worth. After about 10 mins I didn't really care that I wasn't driving the Mech, I just imagined I was in a 2 seater and I was commander/gunner lol. But yea Ultimately I wish it had about another hour of content and a bit more depth to the unlockables.

Great experience, just a short one, the story is ok but would prefer to just get in the action. I didn't have any crashes or glitches like others have commented, worked flawlessly. I would like a few 'arcade' levels at the end, like a shooting gallery with waves of bad-guys, that would really extend the life of the game, but now I've completed it, all I can do is replay the levels (and no doubt watch the same cutscenes again) and change the difficulty. Overall 4 outta 5 as my first VR game it was really impressive, but left me simply wanting more.. much more.
It's quite a nice job ... but ... no translations ... and finished in 3 hours ... But Ok,it's cool to be in a Mech ... just short ... and not difficult at all ... (at least for me)

An arcade style gameplay, you are limited to a set path.  You only control the arms, but with that you have plenty of options.

Aside from the mediocure dialog, and arcade style gameplay, it's the feeling like you are actually in a MECH which makes this game AWESOME!!  Is this a AAA, far from it.  More of a AA game.  Pricepoint is on par.  This is what VR was meant for, when you feel you are actually IN a MECH.

review_title: Generally good but sizes are off
one_reviews_text:
Gameplay has nice flow, it is not so easy as other games and visuals are nice.
The only problem i have is that everything feels to large at about 10%. Similar but opposite to elite dangerous. In ED on Rift everthing looks and feels exactly right but on vive it feels to small. Here it seems to be exactly oposite. In vive the size feels ok but in rift it is to big

There's a lot to like here.  Very good presentation and pretty particle effects.  A variety of weapons and a need to switch between them.  Remember those 90's arcade light gun games?  This is like that, but as a giant robot.
well it look good  and as far a shooting galleries go this one tries harder to give you a story but all in all meh...

No sound settings and graphics

Quiet shots
Immersive gameplay, fantastic story. I'm giddy. WOW
Discription says it does but game does not launch untill Oculus Touch is calabrated. If you don't have Touch you can not get beyond this screen.
gamepad not work
